{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:53.879
    | text      = So, Jordan, today, kind of an interesting thing to talk about.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:56.879
    | text      = What's that?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:57.879
    | text      = We're going to talk a little bit about Bill Cooper.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:59.879
    | text      = Okay.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:00.879
    | text      = Now, we've talked a little bit about Bill Cooper on the show in the past
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:04.879
    | text      = and how he's clearly one of Alex's heroes in the period where Alex was just getting started in media.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:09.879
    | text      = I have a very strong drive to do a lot more coverage about Bill since I find him fascinating.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:14.879
    | text      = But one of the problems I've run into is that Bill's show is often pretty fucking dry.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:18.879
    | text      = A lot of it is him reading long, drawn-out passages from his own book
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:22.879
    | text      = or a letter from one of his listeners who's a member of his dumb intelligence gathering operation, Kaji.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:27.879
    | text      = You combine that dryness with how completely out of line Alex's show has been in the past few months,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:33.879
    | text      = and you have a recipe for me not having the kind of time I need to create the kind of Bill Cooper content
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:38.879
    | text      = I think our audience deserves.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:40.879
    | text      = Rest assured, though, those episodes will come, hopefully, soon.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:43.879
    | text      = In my exploration of Bill, there's a whole lot of exactly what you expect.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:47.879
    | text      = There's a whole lot of old-school conspiracy theory, there's a lot of pretty extreme right-wing malicious sensibilities,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:54.879
    | text      = there's an overwhelming sense of distrust of most of the other people in the militia media landscape.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:59.879
    | text      = It's what you expect.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:02.879
    | text      = I've noticed that one of the things that I resonate most with in terms of doing this show is not the expected, but the peculiar.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:09.879
    | text      = The ways in which Alex is similar to Bill Cooper are largely uninteresting.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:13.879
    | text      = They both love guns, they hate taxes, they have shockingly low standards of evidence for absurd things they want to believe and report as truth.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:21.879
    | text      = What interests me far more is the ways in which Alex is a worse version of the person he's emulating.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:27.879
    | text      = On our last episode about Bill, we experienced how much more competent Bill is at presenting information.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:33.879
    | text      = He actually plays the role of someone trying to prove something, as opposed to Alex who just yells about nonsense and insists it's been proven already.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:40.879
    | text      = Go look it up. It's in the white papers.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:42.879
    | text      = Alex is basically always saying, like, Bill did it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:45.879
    | text      = But without saying that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:46.879
    | text      = Exactly.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:47.879
    | text      = Further, we saw how much better Bill was at broadcasting, how he clearly planned his shows out in advance and incorporated music into the show to reinforce themes.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:55.879
    | text      = Today we're going to look at another difference that I've found between Alex and Bill.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:59.879
    | text      = This difference is a strategic difference, and it's one that makes me think that Bill is pretty sincere about his beliefs, regardless of how dumb they are and misguided his ideas are.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:09.879
    | text      = The difference begins in a similarity.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:12.879
    | text      = Starting out their careers, both Bill Cooper and Alex Jones had to know that the odds were not in their favor.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:18.879
    | text      = They both had views and politics that are not really welcome in mainstream conversation, so the odds of them getting a widely syndicated radio show like Rush Limbaugh or getting a TV show on an actual network? Incredibly slim.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:30.879
    | text      = We've seen that Alex responded to this difficulty by trying to create his own empire.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:35.879
    | text      = He got a little bit of a foothold. He started in, you know, the local AXIS TV show, and then he got a radio show because his dad agreed to pay for advertising.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:45.879
    | text      = And then from there...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:46.879
    | text      = Now he pulled himself up by his bootstraps, Dan.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:48.879
    | text      = From there he found a crazy dude in Ted Anderson who had a gold sales operation that needed a pitchman.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:55.879
    | text      = Alex rose through the ranks through that. Publicity stunt after publicity stunt along the way.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:01.879
    | text      = He managed to create a cottage industry for himself, but at no point would you ever get the sense that he's not what's important.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:09.879
    | text      = Right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:10.879
    | text      = Alex is Infowars.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:12.879
    | text      = Yes.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:13.879
    | text      = Alex is the head of the Liberty Movement.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:15.879
    | text      = Alex is the man who mainstreamed 9-11 Truth.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:20.879
    | text      = Right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:21.879
    | text      = Alex caused Brexit. Alex is, like, it's all about him.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:24.879
    | text      = He's a megalomaniac.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:25.879
    | text      = Yes. Yes. And all of the things, all the trappings, everything around it is in service of building up this greater thing, Infowars.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:34.879
    | text      = Yeah. He's monetized delusions of grandeur.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:38.879
    | text      = True. But the strategy is born out of that megalomania, and his strategy is specifically create your thing.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:49.879
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:50.879
    | text      = He knows that he has no place in mainstream world.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:53.879
    | text      = He's never going to have a column in the New York Times.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:55.879
    | text      = Right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:56.879
    | text      = He's never going to be on Salem Broadcasting, like who syndicate all these other sort of mainline conservative talkers.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:03.879
    | text      = He's never going to be on Fox News. He's never going to have a job in a place of cultural legitimacy.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:10.879
    | text      = Right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:11.879
    | text      = So he knows, I have to create my own thing.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:14.879
    | text      = I believe that Bill Cooper is really interesting because he saw a broader picture than Alex.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:22.879
    | text      = He had to create his own thing in the same way that Alex did.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:25.879
    | text      = Of course.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:26.879
    | text      = So he wrote Behold the Pale Horse, and it became an underground classic.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:30.879
    | text      = He started his own radio show that ended up becoming this shortwave broadcast hour of the time.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:36.879
    | text      = And by October 1993, he was at a point where he realized there are other ways to do this.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:44.879
    | text      = I'm never going to get my own show somewhere else, and maybe I have a limitation in terms of how big I can make this without turning into what Alex has become.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:56.879
    | text      = Right, right, right, right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:57.879
    | text      = I may be assuming that's what he thought. I don't know entirely.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:00.879
    | text      = But on October 15th, 1993, Bill Cooper launched an initiative on his show that I think is one of the most interesting things
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:10.879
    | text      = that a conservative right-wing militia weirdo would ever think to do.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:15.879
    | text      = Tonight, we're going to talk about the media that you and I, the listeners and the people here who produced The Hour of the Time, are going to purchase, folks.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:32.879
    | text      = And we are going to do that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:35.879
    | text      = So Bill Cooper has realized, correctly, that he has no place in mainstream shit.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:40.879
    | text      = He's built his thing and his audience up to a certain point. Best strategy by the media.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:47.879
    | text      = Yes. That's the trick. If you're the boss, you are on your own show. Alex is proof of that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:55.879
    | text      = Alex would never think to do this. It wouldn't be something that he would want to do.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:00.879
    | text      = Bill Cooper is like, all right, look, I don't like the media. We can change that. All we have to do is buy it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:09.879
    | text      = So he's saying that he wants a large group of people to pool their money together in order to achieve a goal that's not possible by himself.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:19.879
    | text      = Well, look, sure, there is that. But the interesting thing is it's very unclear what his plan is as he launches this initiative.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:28.879
    | text      = But it is very clearly ambitious.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:32.879
    | text      = Yes. Yeah. The whole media?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:36.879
    | text      = No. Just a major conglomerate.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:40.879
    | text      = So he starts out here on the 15th of 1993 in October by talking about why you would want to do this.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:47.879
    | text      = And it's because the media has destroyed. So you must reclaim it to rebuild.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:51.879
    | text      = OK. It is absolutely necessary for us to take back this country.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:59.879
    | text      = Since the media has been the main element, it appears to me, in its destruction, then it also appears to me that we need to get control of the media.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:10.879
    | text      = The only way to do that in a capitalistic republic is to purchase the media.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:17.879
    | text      = He's not wrong.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:19.879
    | text      = That is exactly, ladies and gentlemen, what we are going to do.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:26.879
    | text      = Now he's wrong.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:35.879
    | text      = God.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:38.879
    | text      = So, again, we find a thematic song being used to open the show.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:42.879
    | text      = In this case, it's Winger's track from the Bill & Ted soundtrack Battle Stations.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:47.879
    | text      = Some choice lyrics from that song.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:49.879
    | text      = Take no prisoners, open fire, battle stations. Someone's trying to brainwash me, battle stations.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:56.879
    | text      = Wild stallions.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:58.879
    | text      = It's the season to resist pre-programmed morons, computer sleaze.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:03.879
    | text      = It's not nearly as fun of a song as Make It Big, but it's definitely an intentional choice that Bill is making.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:09.879
    | text      = Like, fucking someone's trying to brainwash me, battle stations.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:13.879
    | text      = You're talking about buying the media. Of course, it's great. He's doing what he does.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:18.879
    | text      = Bill's interesting because he seems like a real lyrics guy.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:21.879
    | text      = He doesn't particularly have a genre of music.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:24.879
    | text      = No, play the fucking Deep Cut from the Beach Boys and now Winger.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:27.879
    | text      = Exactly. It's not about the music. It's just like, man, this guy is saying it like it is.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:32.879
    | text      = I think he might actually like Dead Prez or something like that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:35.879
    | text      = He might be surprisingly like, yeah, turn off the radio. Turn off that bullshit.
